docs.lead_paragraph: Even with legislatures in summer recess, there's no lull in the battle over state anti-abortion laws as several federal courts decide whether to uphold or strike down some of the most sweeping measures.

headline.main: Tough Anti-Abortion Laws Examined in Federal Court
headline.print_headline: Tough Anti-Abortion Laws Examined in Federal Court

docs.snippet: Even with legislatures in summer recess, there's no lull in the battle over state anti-abortion laws as several federal courts decide whether to uphold or strike down some of the most sweeping measures.

docs.lead_paragraph: The biggest schools in college sports are about to get a chance to make their own rules.

docs.lead_paragraph: The drug for hepatitis C has the popularity of a mass-market drug but the price of a specialty drug, adding up to huge costs that are worrying insurers.

headline.main: Why the Price of Sovaldi Is a Shock to the System

docs.snippet: The drug for hepatitis C has the popularity of a mass-market drug but the price of a specialty drug, adding up to huge costs that are worrying insurers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Smokers seeking a job in one Arizona county need not apply and current employees would pay the price for lighting up under a controversial proposal by its top administrator.

headline.main: Arizona County Proposes Hiring Ban, Extra Charges for Smokers
headline.print_headline: Arizona County Proposes Hiring Ban, Extra Charges for Smokers

docs.snippet: Smokers seeking a job in one Arizona county need not apply and current employees would pay the price for lighting up under a controversial proposal by its top administrator.

docs.lead_paragraph: A dark horse in the New Hampshire race for the U.S. Senate who has been fighting big money in politics got a surprise boost last week from a like-minded group - to the tune of $2 million.

headline.main: New Hampshire Candidate Cashes In on Campaign Finance Reform
headline.print_headline: New Hampshire Candidate Cashes In on Campaign Finance Reform

docs.snippet: A dark horse in the New Hampshire race for the U.S. Senate who has been fighting big money in politics got a surprise boost last week from a like-minded group - to the tune of $2 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: Patient advocates say some insurance companies are making HIV and AIDS drugs unaffordable in plans issued through the Affordable Care Act by shifting much of the cost to customers.

headline.print_headline: AIDS Patients Fear Discrimination in ACA Exchange

docs.lead_paragraph: States that embraced the Affordable Care Act had the best results in reducing the uninsured, according to a Gallup survey, with Arkansas and Kentucky leading the way.

headline.main: Gains Under Health Law Show What Is Possible for Other Poor States

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican U.S. Rep. Kerry Bentivolio, considered by some to be an "accidental" congressman, was easily defeated Tuesday in a Michigan district and became the third U.S. House incumbent to lose his seat this year.

headline.main: Michigan GOP US House Incumbent Loses Primary
headline.print_headline: Michigan GOP US House Incumbent Loses Primary

docs.snippet: Republican U.S. Rep. Kerry Bentivolio, considered by some to be an "accidental" congressman, was easily defeated Tuesday in a Michigan district and became the third U.S. House incumbent to lose his seat this year.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Internal Revenue Service has provided nearly accurate information on eligibility data for consumers who sought subsidized health coverage through Obamacare's private insurance exchanges, a federal watchdog said on Tuesday.

headline.main: U.S. Watchdog Gives IRS High Marks on Obamacare Eligibility Data
headline.print_headline: U.S. Watchdog Gives IRS High Marks on Obamacare Eligibility Data

docs.snippet: The U.S. Internal Revenue Service has provided nearly accurate information on eligibility data for consumers who sought subsidized health coverage through Obamacare's private insurance exchanges, a federal watchdog said on Tuesday.
